Has anyone been watching Rome?
 
 http://www.hbo.com/rome/
 
 It is on BBC in the UK and I think it is on HBO in the US. It is a very good show and it puts me in mind of other classic TV series set in the times of the Roman Empire such as 'I, Claudius'.
 
 The two main characters of Pollo and Vorenus(who is played by Scottish actor Kevin McKidd) draw you into the story. The political machinations of pre-empire Rome are as murky as you expect. 
 
 This is what modern TV should be like, I say get rid of all those reality shows( or the celebrity equivalents) and do more productions like this.

 I can't imagine what the show costs to produce per episode with all the sets, cameras, and wardrobe, but the visual presentation of the show is incredible. It brings ancient Rome to life. I imagine the price tag is one of the main reasons there aren't more shows like it.
